know two approaches exception handling lets look them. contract approach. method says method header throw exception. thus method "promises" operation fails reason throw exception. exceptional approach. throw exceptions something truly weird happens. use exceptions resolve situation normal control flow statements . use exceptions control flow might contract approach. lets use approaches different cases: customer class method called orderproduct. contract approach: class customer public void orderproduct product product m_credit - product.price < 0 throw new nocreditexception "not enough credit!" stuff exceptional approach: class customer public bool orderproduct product product m_credit - product.price < 0 return false stuff return true ! customer.orderproduct product console.writeline "not enough credit!" else go life prefer exceptional approach truly exceptional customer money assuming win lottery. situation err contract style. exceptional: class carcontroller returns null car creation failed. public car createcar string model something went wrong wrong model return null call method called createcar damn wel expect car instance instead lousy null pointer ravage running code dozen lines later. thus prefer contract one: class carcontroller public car createcar string model something went wrong wrong model throw new carmodelnotknownexception "model unkown" return new car style use think best general approach exceptions exception handling: contract vs exceptional approach
